title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 146-3.7 - Meal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 146-3.7 - Meal

State Regulations
(a) A
meal
shall provide adequate portions of a variety of
wholesome, nutritious foods and shall include at least one of the types of food
from all four of the following groups: (1)
fruits or vegetables; (2)
grains or
potatoes; (3)
eggs, meat, fish, poultry, dairy, or legumes; and
(4)
tea, coffee, milk or juice. (b) Meals
shall be deemed to
be furnished by an employer to an employee when made available to that employee
during reasonable meal periods and customarily eaten by that
employee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
146-3.7

Amended

New

York State Register December 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 52, eff. 12/31/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
